meanings.definition: Metal strands used to conduct electricity or transmit signals.
meanings.sent1: The electrician connected the wires to power the light bulb.
meanings.sent2: The wires in the computer carry information from one part to another.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the wires to swing from tree to tree.
meanings.sent4: His words were like live wires, sparking excitement in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The wires hummed with energy, lighting up the room.

meanings.definition: A system of wires used for fencing or support.
meanings.sent1: The farmer repaired the wires of the fence to keep the sheep safe.
meanings.sent2: The telephone poles were connected by a network of wires.
meanings.sent3: The wires of the fence played jump rope with the playful dog.
meanings.sent4: The wires of friendship held them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The wires of the bridge stretched across the river, providing stability.

meanings.definition: To equip or connect with wires.
meanings.sent1: She carefully wires the new lamp to the ceiling for better lighting.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic wires the car engine to ensure proper functioning.
meanings.sent3: He wires the doorbell to play a funny tune when pressed.
meanings.sent4: The artist wires the sculpture to create a sense of movement.
meanings.sent5: The electrician wires the entire house to bring power to every room.
